newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia's Sharp denies improper buying role.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia's Sharp denies improper buying role.

text.p: Australian Transport Minister John Sharp on Tuesday denied Labor opposition allegations he had played an improper role in the government purchase of air-sea rescue equipment.
Sharp told parliament he had not been involved in a decision by the government's aviation agency, AirServices Australia, to buy air-sea rescue units without a tender.
"When it comes to the evidence of my involvement, there is no question that everything was done properly," he said.
Labor accused Sharp of intervening in AirServices Australia's decision to spend A$700,000 on 104 Precision Aerial Delivery System (PADS) units.
Labor also said Sharp had misled parliament, a serious breach of ministerial conduct, over his role.
Sharp said he had watched a demonstration of the equipment, but had no other involvement in the purchase.
